data.title: Katatonic Silentio - Mantis 11
data.blurb: Mind-bogglingly immersive, ultra-inventive techno from one of the most exciting names around.

data.title: Caterina Barbieri - Myuthafoo
data.blurb: This companion to the Italian artist's 2019 album is colder and bleaker, but gripping all the same.

data.title: Lucy Liyou - Dog Dreams
data.blurb: Subtle but impressively dynamic ambient music informed by Mariah Carey and Disney movies—in a good way.

data.title: Wata Igarashi - Agartha
data.blurb: The Japanese techno maestro explores Krautrock and '90s electronica on an incredible debut album.

data.title: Perko - Prang / Sisu
data.blurb: Half club and half ambient, Perko delivers his best work yet, with two esteemed collaborators.

data.title: Mr. G - Pearls Don't Lay On The Shore
data.blurb: Mr. G strays far from the funky tech house that made him a household name in dance music, plunging instead into a delightful abyss.

data.title: Kelela - Raven
data.blurb: Kelela returns with her usual lush, seductive lyricism and vocal prowess, this time over quiet, aquatic beats.

data.title: crimeboys - very dark past
data.blurb: Ambient club artists Pontiac Streator and Special Guest DJ team up for an intriguingly ravey album.

data.title: Tujiko Noriko - Cr​é​puscule I & II
data.blurb: Gripping, emotional ambient music that emphasizes the passage of time and holding onto what you love.

data.title: Marco Zenker - Channel Balance
data.blurb: The first Zenker Brothers solo album dives deep into a dub abyss.

data.title: Deepchord - Functional Designs
data.blurb: Another banner entry in a dub techno discography that, somehow, keeps getting better and better.

data.title: Gi Gi - Sunchoke
data.blurb: Ambient jungle-not-jungle that strikes all the right notes, touching on Krautrock, The Orb and more.

data.title: Emeka Ogboh - 6°30'33​.​372
data.blurb: The experimental artist pens another immersive techno love letter to Lagos, enriched with field recordings that evoke the fast-beating heart of the city.

data.title: Salamanda - ashbalkum
data.blurb: The Seoul duo's third LP is their most expansive to date, adding a depth of emotion (and shades of techno) to their curious rhythms and whimsical melodies.

data.title: Time Wharp - Spiro World
data.blurb: A virtuosic display of ambient and downtempo musicianship.

data.title: Kode9 - Escapology
data.blurb: One part of a new piece by the Hyperdub boss that explores themes of space colonization and the breakup of the UK, featuring some of Kode9's most incredible rhythms yet.

data.title: Carmen Villain - Only Love From Now On
data.blurb: Richly textured and generously emotional, Carmen Villain's fifth album is a masterpiece of jazz-informed ambient and downtempo.

data.title: Marina Herlop - Pripyat
data.blurb: Marina Herlop's wordless vocal pieces take on a sinister but more colorful edge on this astounding work for voice, piano and electronics.

data.title: Various - A Collective Memoir
data.blurb: A gripping, sometimes devastating portrait of cultural heritage and history from producers across Central Asia and Eastern Europe.

data.title: Tangerine Dream - Raum
data.blurb: Don't call it a comeback, but this LP—carrying the spirit of Edgar Froese's musical genius—is the best Tangerine Dream record in decades.

data.title: Huerco S. - Plonk
data.blurb: An eerie and beautiful album from the Kansas producer that builds vivid worlds out of techno and ambient.

data.title: Fort Romeau - Beings Of Light
data.blurb: A rich, sometimes spiritual album inspired by the unique photography of Steven F. Arnold.

data.title: Beast Nest - Sicko
data.blurb: Grief, catharsis and healing define this stunning part-ambient, part-noise, part-techno piece from the Oakland musician.

data.title: Jake Muir - Mana
data.blurb: An eye-opening, occasionally mind-melting redefinition of illbient.

data.title: Arca - KICK ii, KicK iii, kick iiii & kiCK iiiii
data.blurb: A bold outpouring of emotion and chaos across four LPs dedicated to Arca's many musical personalities.

data.title: Various - Tresor 30
data.blurb: Thirty years on, the Berlin institution shows why they're the tastemakers while reminding everyone how this scene was built on the back of Detroit.

data.title: Nala Sinephro - Space 1.8
data.blurb: The new Warp Records artist delivers a calming, restorative and mind-expanding blend of jazz and ambient.

data.title: Space Afrika - Honest Labour
data.blurb: The duo reach new emotional heights on this feature-heavy paean to their hometown of Manchester.

data.title: Perila - How Much Time It Is Between You And Me?
data.blurb: A masterful album from a talented artist who infuses ambient music with ASMR textures.

data.title: Maxwell Sterling - Turn Of Phrase
data.blurb: Modern classical meets IDM on a truly stunning record.

data.title: Andy Stott - Never The Right Time
data.blurb: A noir-pop milestone for the Manchester artist.

data.title: Christina Chatfield - Sutro
data.blurb: A touching, occasionally epic exercise in chill-out room ambient techno.

data.title: Only Now & Beneath The Ruins - Destiny
data.blurb: Kush Arora and King Woman guitarist Peter Arensdorf come together for crushing doom electronics.

data.title: Dax Pierson - Nerve Bumps (A Queer Divine Dissatisfaction)
data.blurb: The American artist reckons with grief and the long road to recovery on an LP fusing post-punk, ambient and IDM.

data.title: Shawn Rudiman - Flow State
data.blurb: Unmoored from techno, the Pittsburgh artist hits creative heights.

data.title: Yu Su - Yellow River Blue
data.blurb: Yu Su's daydreamy debut album delivers.

data.title: Virtual Dreams: Ambient Explorations In The House & Techno Age, 1993-1997
data.blurb: The aesthetic triumph of ambient and chillout.

data.title: Dark0 - ZERO2
data.blurb: A melody-driven mixtape from the London producer.

data.title: KMRU - Peel
data.blurb: In just 48 hours, KMRU made something more than worthy of Editions Mego's stellar catalogue.

data.title: Various - Physically Sick 3
data.blurb: Discwoman and Allergy Season's inspired charity compilation captures some of the most exciting sounds in electronic music right now.

data.title: Actress - 88
data.blurb: As the prequel to the much-anticipated Karma & Desire, 88 has a lot to offer.

data.title: INT*era - Aqueduct
data.blurb: Soaring rhythms and cosmic ambience from PLO Man, C3D-E and Hashman Deejay.

data.title: Axel Boman - Eyes Of My Mind
data.blurb: A would-be summer hit from the Swedish producer.

data.title: Various - Still In My Arms
data.blurb: Cry-in-the-club IDM.

data.title: Various - Frequencies From The Edge Of The Tektonic Plate
data.blurb: Unique '90s mystic rave bangers.

data.title: Ulla - Tumbling Towards A Wall
data.blurb: Spine-tingling ambient that will tumble around your brain long after the music stops.

data.title: Various - A Short Illness From Which He Never Recovered
data.blurb: A key experimental label says goodbye with an excellent compilation of ghostly, skeletal rock.

data.title: Madteo - Dropped Out Sunshine
data.blurb: The New York artist sounds weirder and more inspired than ever.

data.title: Skee Mask - ISS04
data.blurb: Techno, ambient and dubstep, Skee Mask style.

data.title: Boreal Massif - We All Have An Impact
data.blurb: One of 2019's best albums considers the climate crisis through a deeply atmospheric trip-hop lens.

data.title: Telefon Tel Aviv - Dreams Are Not Enough
data.blurb: The first Telefon Tel Aviv album in ten years reveals a refined and rejuvenated sound.

data.title: Barker - Utility
data.blurb: A deeply distinctive style of techno flourishes on this superb LP.

data.title: Kelela & Asmara - Aquaphoria
data.blurb: A tender ambient mix from two essential artists.

data.title: Mort Garson ‎- Mother Earth's Plantasia
data.blurb: An ambient cult classic from the '70s that showed the Moog's early potential.

data.title: Burial - Claustro / State Forest
data.blurb: The London icon's first release in two years.

data.title: Yu Su - 泉出通川为谷 / Roll With The Punches
data.blurb: Ambient and downtempo for blissful moments of escape.

data.title: The Caretaker - Everywhere At The End Of Time (Stage 6)
data.blurb: The final instalment of a profound ambient project.

data.title: Floating Points - LateNightTales
data.blurb: A standout mix of mellow soul, jazz, ambient and more.

data.title: Efdemin - New Atlantis
data.blurb: Efdemin combines techno with avant-garde ideas on this inspired fourth album.

data.title: King Midas Sound - Solitude
data.blurb: Themes of loss, heartbreak and obsession make for Kevin Martin and Roger Robinson's bleakest record.

data.title: Various - Kankyō Ongaku: Japanese Ambient, Environmental & New Age Music 1980-1990
data.blurb: An exceptional overview of '80s Japanese ambient and environmental music.

data.title: Ossia - Devil's Dance
data.blurb: A wild ride through the Bristol artist's darkest musical impulses.

data.title: Laurie Spiegel - The Expanding Universe / Unseen Worlds
data.blurb: Essential reissues of the innovative US composer's first two albums.

data.title: DJ Sports - Akrasia
data.blurb: Tender jungle and ambient.

data.title: Anthony Naples - Take Me With You
data.blurb: The perfect afterparty album.

data.title: Nmesh / Telepath - ロストエデンへのパス (The Path To Lost Eden)
DJ Healer - Nothing 2 Loose / Prime Minister Of Doom - Mudshadow Propaganda
Christoph De Babalon - If You're Into It, I'm Out Of It
Hiroshi Yoshimura - Music For Nine Post Cards
House Of Dad - House Of Dad
Vito Ricci - I Was Crossing A Bridge
DJ Sotofett - Drippin' For A Tripp (Tripp-A-Dubb-Mix)
Symmetry - Themes for an Imaginary Film
Nicolas Jaar - Space Is Only Noise
The Black Dog - Music for Real Airports
Leyland Kirby - Sadly, The Future Is No Longer What It Was
